Review title: Expected it to be bad...and I LOVED IT
Review_body: With so many bad reviews you'd think it was actually bad. Just finished watching it and I was blown away. It was so well done. It was beautiful and inspiring. I encourage everyone to actually watch the film and form their own review.
Very entertaining. Great story and good acting. We and our 11 years old daughter all loved it.

Everything that made the original movie fun and enjoyable, has been cut...The crazy grandma, the song, Mushu and so on...You can't make a mulan movie, without the most memorable character (Mushu)
Even if it was free on disney plus, it wouldn't be worth watching...
It was entertaining and good movie. Story progress was pretty solid. Much better movie than expected from critical reviews

Review title: This is not a remake. If you know that beforehand, its a lot more enjoyable.
Review_body: Loved this movie. After reading the reviews I was fully prepaired to hate it, but it was free on Disney + and Mulan is one of my favorite cartoon movies so I watched it anyway. First, if you are coming in to this with the expectation of just seeing the 1998 cartoon in live action, you are going to be disappointed. Unlike the other Disney live actions, this is not them telling the same story with a few changes. This is more like a completely different movie altogether about the same character. I wouldnt even put it in the same genre as the other. Kind of like how the Disney beauty and the beast is different from the Brothers Grim version, and different from the CW version, and that 90s show version that was on back in the day. There are no talking animals, musical numbers, or funny grandmas. Its a more serious movie so if you are going into it expecting light hearted kiddy fun like the cartoon or the other Disney live action remakes, you arent going to like it. However, it is a really good movie with breathtaking scenery and some cool action scenes. So if you go into it with the mindset of just wanting to watch a cool fantacy/ action flick thats clean enough for the whole family, you should thoroughly enjoy this.

I really, really liked this movie! Now, I am quite critical with movies, and I am usually bored by all the dull, repetitive movies coming out of Hollywood; I also don't see the point of Disney's remakes of all their animated movies, but this movie was so much better than my expectations! The story was convincing, the acting flawless, the scenery picturesque, and the movie was really funny to boot! As compared to all the other reviewers, I actually liked the added character of the bitter witch, who gets all sold out to Mulan, because she is sticking to her values and showing her that there is a better way. Two thumbs up from me for this little fantasy gem!
It's not a bad movie by any means, it's cinematically beautiful but the place they filmed and the lead actresses failures and controversies make this hard to enjoy.

Review title: It's Disney's Version of a Martial Arts Action Movie
Review_body: Watching this, at first I thought it was a bad movie. Then I had a realization. This isn't a remake of the cartoon, it's not a princess movie, it's not a fairytale, it's not the normal way Disney does folklore. Live action Mulan is a Samurai movie. It's got the sword fighting, the improbably/impossible acrobatic fighting, historical setting, honor, and even magic/mysticism.Of course the problem with that is that Samurai are Japanese, not Chinese. So, it's more accurate to call it a Martial Arts Action Movie set in a fantasy version of ancient China.The quasi-historical setting has some problems too. Disney has a tendency to pick and choose things based on aesthetics rather than historic accuracy in their stories. They need to make better use of cultural experts so as to avoid problems like this. In this case, that round village house that she lived in wouldn't have been built until several centuries after the story of Mulan was supposed to take place. Also, it was in an entirely different region of China. So, that part isn't great.Personally, I think if you go into it expecting a martial arts, action movie you'll probably like it okay. But you need to have that expectation going into it. If you are expecting something like the cartoon, you'll be in the wrong mindset to enjoy it because you'll be expecting entirely the wrong genre.As for the plot, I like that it doesn't end in her getting married. It actually ends in her getting a job offer that uses her skills and brings honor to her family. And I like that they didn't repeat the cartoon version's cross-dressing for comic effect which is super cringy now.I don't think it's a great Disney movie, but so long as you are in the right mindset going into it, it is enjoyable.

Review title: Not as bad as the poor reviews indicate
Review_body:
Before I write this review, the disclaimer I should state is that I look at all movies (especially remakes) as standalone movies. I don't think it's fair to compare remakes to the original. This is because anyone who goes to the trouble of remaking a movie will most likely make changes to the original to add a bit a uniqueness to the film. While not always true, this is true in most cases. If you think about it, that makes sense. If the remake is an exact duplicate of the original, why bother looking at the remake? There just isn't a large enough market for that kind of film.
That is the basis of my rating. Judging the movie on it's own merits, without comparing to the original, I think this a fine movie. The cinematography is excellent, although it does suffer from not being in the theater, but that is not the fault of the movie. I think it's fair to handicap it for that reason. The acting is fine. While not superlative, I think it was more than adequate. If I handicap the acting, then I would actually rank the acting higher. I'll explain later. Story, scenery, action, etc. were all top notch. There were a few slow spots, which is the basis behind my dropping it a star. Otherwise, if I judge this movie on its own merits, I think it's easily a 9. However, I think it might be more interesting to explain why I think all the people who ranked this movie poorly are wrong.
Many of the negative reviews were based on comparisons to the original. No music, no Mushu, etc. I already mentioned earlier that I think it's wrong to judge a movie, even a remake, by comparing to the original. I believe that kind of criteria is unfair because any remake most likely contains changes from the original. If your favorite bit from the original is dropped, then you automatically hate the remake. I think that is an unfair criteria.
Another common criticism to the movie was the lack of historical accuracy. For example, the tulous that Mulan grew up in didn't exist at the time of the ballad. Additionally, the tulous are in a different part of China than where the Rouran battles were fought. I don't disagree these or historically inaccurate, but any film, especially Disney films, are created for entertainment, not to be a history lesson. Additionally, the primary market for the film is America. The average American knows little of Chinese history at any level of detail so this probably wouldn't bother them. I think of it in terms of what I have seen in American movies. It's not uncommon for location shooting to have sequential scenes that don't make sense. For example, a guy walks down a street, turns a corner and is in a separate part of town. They do this for the cinematic and photographic qualities, not to be geographically accurate, So I handicap Mulan for this as I look at it in the same way.
The last thing I'll counter the criticism on is the acting, in particular Liu YiFei. I have read numerous criticisms as to how people didn't like it. Actually, I thought she did a pretty good job. Her acting skills are very good. But I also handicapped that because she is Chinese by birth and Mandarin is her native language. I have seen her acting in Mandarin language films and she is very good, and very talented. I think it must be difficult to speak in your non-native language, but also enormously difficult to act in your non-native language.
Along those lines, and my earlier comment on accuracy, if people were so bent on that, then this film should have been shot in Mandarin and we should have English sub-titles. However, as I mentioned earlier, this film was created primarily for the English speaking audiences, so a lot of compromises were made.
That leads me to my final comment. One of the biggest downsides to this film that I see that led to the criticisms were, in my opinion, a result of the compromises that had to be made to satisfy the worldwide market. Invariably, when you compromise that much, you wind up with people dissatisfied everywhere. The lack of understanding of Chinese culture by Americans led to several compromises that probably set off the Chinese audience which made them unhappy. Another thing that hurt, I believe, was the enormously bad reviews the film got prior to overseas release. That can't help but influence opinion. But as I mentioned earlier, I think most of the bad reviews were unwarranted.
Basically, as a standalone film, without using the original film as a prejudicial comparison, I think this is actually a really good movie.

Review title: The worst Disney production ever made, full stop
Review_body: I am in my 30's and have watched and continue to watch all these amazing Disney movies and animated cartoons.Mulan is the first time in my entire life where I literally fell asleep and didn't even bother finishing the movie after waking up.What happened? This is so so bland compared to the old cartoon. The story became like a boring war movie, where's the Disney fantasy? Nothing in this movie screams Disney to me. And please don't say that because it's a movie they couldn't keep all the fantastical stuff, see how they handled the Beauty and the Beast and it was perfect.After researching it seems that this movie got heavily censored by China's oppressive regime. For example the lack of Mushu seems to be because China thought it would trivialize their culture. Really?The producer and writer for this turd of a movie should be ashamed. They had a golden opportunity from a beloved story, and they blew it just to try to make their movie whitelisted in China. End result is everyone seems to hate it, nice job you morons.

I don't know why some people didn't like it. I loved it. I've seen the original cartoon and loved that version as well but this version was really good. The story, acting and filmed was awesome. My kids loved it as well. Great Job Disney.

They changed out Milan's grandmother with a sister, the start of the movie was not even included in the original.
They discarded mushu and replaced him with a Phoenix, they added totally new characters.
If the movie was on its own it would probably be great. But to be a live action version of Mulan it really sucks. Too much is different and to me it really ruins the whole essence of the film. They ruined such a good cartoon with this. It did not make it justice whatsoever and it is such a missed opportunity

You can not compare between the original Mulan and this version. Because they have different main story. I just watch this movie and forget about the cartoon version, I can give 7 score. Then I rewatch the cartoon version, so I will give 5 score for this movie. The characteristic of disney movie is the song. In this movie even Mulan is not singing like the cartoon version. There is something missing in this movie.

After viewing this movie all I can say it was repetitive and really didn't have a great storyline. It was lacking humor, happiness, soundtrack, I got bored after the battle I was expecting a better ending, and was waiting for interests. I'm sorry will not watch again. Overall feeling dissatisfied

The 2020 Mulan is for a different audience from the original cartoon Mulan. This Mulan is not a cartoon, it is not a musical, nor is it filled with comic relief, but the movie was great. It was genius to be able to take the simple movie and transform it into a movie about a young woman going against a system that de-valued her. The progression of events followed the cartoon very well, but there was an element of reality superimposed on the cartoon so seamlessly that it almost made me forget the cartoon. Yet, the elements were there, the little girl chasing the farm animals, the offer of engagement ruined, the call to war for each family, the theft of her father's sword and joining the war under false pretense, the avalanche, and so on. The witch was the element that confused me at the beginning of the movie. Hayabusa, Shan Yu's bird did spy on Mulan in the original movie and as the movie progressed, I could see the connection to the witch in the 2020 version of Mulan.This movie allowed Mulan to develop. It allowed her to search her soul and step up to be her honest and true self, rather than be exposed by others. I believe the bad reviews are from people who were looking for the same movie only with real people. This is an excellent movie. It has elements of history and culture that intrigue and interest me.The end was wonderful and quite surprising to me. I recommend it to people who are looking for a movie than contains social change, personal conflict, self sacrifice, family loyalty and love.
I have only 1 thing to say and that is: this movie was terrible.

Review title: Amazing take on the original if you don't compare!
Review_body: I feel people were expecting it to be too much like the original. I agree I love a Disney song, mushu, the comedic characters and romance in the original and would have loved to hear her sing but as a new interpretation I felt the movie was amazing in its own way and these aspects would have possibly taken away from the strong message that was in this movie and the more real approach.I loved seeing the empowerment of Mulan and her speaking from a woman's point of view to the other warriors without them even knowing she is a woman. This movie shows how strong and powerful woman can be and although the witch seemed random she was showing how Mulan could have become.I was hoping for romance at the end but I agree with Mum that it shows a woman doesn't always need a man and can be strong on he, although I am secretly hoping for a second film where maybe some romance does spark.People need to watch this as if it's a new film, enjoy the amazing visuals and not expect it to be exactly like the original. People complained the lion king was too similar so you can't really win.

Review title: Not what we expected, but loved it!
Review_body: Just watched the new Mulan with my family on Disney+. We didn't know what to expect but we're pleasantly surprised with the strong storyline, characters, action scenes, suspense and ending...I even got a little teared up at the end but loved that my daughters felt inspired as "warriors.' I credit Disney with reimagining one of their most iconic animated films into an action packed family film. Would my kids have loved a musical? Sure. This isn't that, which is ok. I think those who didn't like this version would have preferred a remake like the Lion King, which was the same exact movie. We loved it and I know you will too.

Mulan was an awesome movie!! Don't listen to all of those negative reviews. I like that there is no singing because then it applies to more people. Many guys do not like all the singing....but now with no singing everyone likes it!! Mulan is a nice movie with awesome sword moves and fighting. (Note: I am a girl, and I am glad there is no singing and lots of fighting.) Just watch it, then you can see if you like it or not. If you don't like it, at least you watched it! If you do, then you have another favorite movie!!

Review title: Not sure why all the bad reviews
Review_body: I loved it. I liked the cartoon and I liked this version too. Maybe people just expect too much from a movie. Or they just like to bash things. I thought it was beautifully shot and well acted. Will definitely watch it again sometime.
Turned it on for my 7 to but she got bored. I watched the whole thing and loved it. Highly recommend!

This movie is an amazing recreation of the legend of Hua Mulan. If I might like to change something it would be the title: Hua Mulan instead of Mulan.
Of course don't expect the same Disney animation story and let yourself dive into this exclusive legend of Hua Mulan. I recommend!
Looks like a bad rippoff off the Disney animated film.

The only characters I knew the name of by the end of the movie were Mulan and Yao, yet even he was an extremely shallow character. Mulan basically became Goku and stomped everyone into submission as well, the threat didn't feel very large.

Another massive letdown. They somehow managed to strip away everything that made the original movie so amazing. I understand the desire to create something different from the original, but it was so poorly executed.
I thought there were some beautiful scenes in this film, but the moments of good cinematography were GREATLY overshadowed by the ridiculous slow motion matrix-esqe shots and the horrendous close ups complete with strange filter effects.
The most disappointing aspect of this film for me was the complete lack of characterization. The villains were nowhere near as scary as Shan Yu, the soldiers felt like after thoughts, Mulan's family was uninteresting. Shockingly in a cast full of lackluster characters, Mulan somehow managed to be the most boring of them all.
All in all, this was another lazy, unnecessary live action remake, completely devoid of even a fraction of the heart present in the original.
As disappointed as I am with this movie, I am more disappointed in myself that I expected anything other than what it was.

I haven't seen the original Mulan, so I don't know if it was true to the original. But hey if it's gonna be just another remake that's like the original there's no point in remaking it, right?!? I mean why bother. I like the film cos it underscores the cultural animosity against women. That bit is emphasized quite a bit and I think it's necessary to provide the modern viewer the context and milieu in which Mulan becomes extraordinary. Also like the fact that the romance does not define the character. It's there in the background but Mulan's identity and character is not defined by it.There are some fantasy elements and that to me is the only bit that did not ring true. I mean i wljld have been ok seeing a witch and a phoenix in Harry Potter

Review title: Don't let these reviews put you off
Review_body: I really enjoyed this film, YES it is slightly different to the cartoon but I think for the better. Who would want the cartoon told the same way plus all the the songs, a the dragon and a cricket up her back side? Its a feel good film. Some people can't leg go and move on from the cartoon.....
So much expectations for nothing. Compared to the original Mulan movie this one is horrible. I only rate 2 and not 1 because of the efforts in the special effects...

The beginning is a little rough but I thought the movie was very entertaining, true to the story, and the best live action re-make so far. I am not sure why it gets such bad reviews honestly. It obviously could not follow the animated one completely but they give it a spin with magic in what seemed to follow the tradition of wuxia/ kung fu movies. I enjoyed it and would watch it again.

As soon as i began watching on Disney+ i knew i had been scammed. Almost everything about it was cheap and 2- dimensional; the set design, screenplay, script, cast and especially the acting. congratulations on devastating a beautiful story and condemning the imaginations of children.

Review title: Well Disney made a Chinese B movie...
Review_body: Bad acting, bad lines, bad plot and the scenes never blended well together. For a Disney movie with lots of resources I expected way more. Also I'm totally okay that there were differences between the cartoon Mulan and this version, however one of the main characteristics of the character Mulan is that she was clever and thought outside of the box. She saved China because she was witty and willing to do things differently than others. In the 2020 version she saved all of China because she had super powers. This gives a completely different feel to the movie, and totally misses the point of what the meaning of the show is all about. And what was up with that Phoenix? It showed up at random times and never really helped her. Mulan is also a movie about family, aren't her ancestors supposed to actually help her not just fly around in times of trouble to show her that they are present?
Enjoyed this Mulan as much as I enjoyed the original! I don't understand the poor reviews. If you watch it as a reimagined movie instead of a remake I think you'll enjoy it too!

Want to know a good test of whether someone is a simpleton or not?
If they enjoyed this horrendous flop. There is simply nothing positive I can say about it.This movie was insipid, uninspiring, forced, and I had to stop watching halfway.I am Chinese, and I am embarrassed, borderline offended this movie exists.

What more is there to be said Mulan (2020)? It has horrendously edited action scenes, new characters that are pointless, and worst of them all, a plot that is stretched out too thin.
The beauty of the original Mulan was its simplicity. It didn't go on for two hours and instead it was short, had a nice message, and that was it. No stupid witch or Phoenix characters or pointless shots just padding out the runtime.
You can't even defend the CGI, which looks so bad, it almost looks like a parody!
In fact, I'll go even as far to say that the whole movie looks like a parody. When I was watching this, I was thinking to myself that there was no way in hell this was made by the same company that made the original. There is no way!
Now I did get some ironic laughs, but at the end of the day, it's just a joyless, overly-long and pointless movie.
I haven't given it 1/10 because as I said I did get a couple of ironic laughs but, ..........it's still pretty bad. I do not recommend this movie to anyone and I'm giving it a 2/10.
The movie is sooo good! I love all the casts and actors, they did well. Watch it. You will love it

Review title: Distortion of the entire message of the original
Review_body: I must admit that I had high expectations for this movie considering the original is my favourite Disney film from my childhood. The controversies surrounding it before it's release cemented for me that I wouldn't enjoy it nearly as much, and I wasn't going to watch it at all until my sister put it on last night.My favourite thing about the original Mulan is the message it sends to young girls. Mulan goes to war to protect her father and when she starts off, she's not good at any of the training because she's never experienced it before. However, through hard-work, determination and intelligence she works to become a valued member of the army. Young girls can watch this film and see how completely normal women can achieve as much as anyone else. This film shoves this entire sentiment right in the bin. By making Mulan have special powers, it tells girls that you can only be on par with men when you have superpowers, which is straight up an awful message.Beyond this, the movie is dull and flat without any of the original music or slightly interesting dialogue between characters. The idea that songs makes a film less serious is so flawed by itself and without it this film barely distinguishes between different emotional beats. For example, the abrupt ending of 'A girl worth fighting for' in the original hits so much harder emotionally than the burning village in this film. Furthermore, all the comedy is completely taken out of this film. I understand they wanted a more mature tone, but isn't this still meant to be a kids film? The writing throughout this film is weak, lacks any sense of comedy, and distorts any values of honour by just repeating the fact that you need to have honour over and over again.I have many issues with this film without even going into the superiority of the plot points in the original film. I can excuse changing points as to not copy the original completely, and I can excuse getting rid of characters like Mushu, however I cannot excuse the total lack of awareness these filmmakers have displayed of the original message of Mulan and the general bad filmmaking.

This movie was nothing like the animation. I grew up with Mulan animation and it was my favorite movie but I was very disappointed in this movie. It might as well have a different title because it'a nothing like the real movie!
Terrific fighting scenes but good storyline,I could have Been better

After hearing some not so great opinions about this film I came to watch it with an open mind, accepting it as its own movie not a remake. I felt little connection with the characters and I think the lack of sound tracks doesn't help at all, surprised for Disney. Although I approached this as its own movie there are some things that I felt shouldn't have been left out. The cutting of her hair being the main one, cutting of a girls hair brings a lot of empowerment and really pulls on those heart strings - I don't even recall there being a scene where they focus on her putting her hair in a bun! Why does she take off all her armour when she's riding back into battle - like I get it you're female keep ya clothes on, taking your hair out the bun would of done the trick - the front of the chest plate was already damaged and undone from the throwing knife. Lastly I did not like the witch character.. was not needed and she definitely didn't need to shape shift it was like an easy way out for the movie to hurry up - "loyal, brave, true" was repeated throughout the whole movie, instead of using her magic to get the emperors soldiers to stand down why couldn't have used disloyalty, cowardly and untrue people to turn against the emperor - more believable and would give your viewers more drama to enjoy.Plus points - The scenery is beautiful and actors were great!

Don't expect songs and mu shu (get over it) but still is an exciting movie.
Loved the trama and how they handle a more mature vision of the legend.
Would be pretty dull seeing exactly the same 90's version.
I really like it and the message worth every minute of it.

Where is mushu!! I gave it a 2/10 because the film didn't meet my expectations. I thought I was going to see a real live version of the animated mulan but instead I got something completely different, and what was worse there was another women involved which made no sense to the original movie and what sucked so bad is that I didn't get to see mushu or Shang. Atleast keep the same people. The trailer was way better than the movie itself.

It was not a remake of the original Mulan rather it was a retelling of a great story. Sure they completely added some things and discarded others but the story itself was incredible. Mulan is my all time favorite Disney movie and I was not offended by this retelling at all. It was a great work of a reimagined story and is truly beautiful my favorite retold Disney story yet. I absolutely love this style of motion picture whether it be tv shows movies etc. Beautiful.
It is a good movie well worth to watch! Since I had not watch the original I had normal Disney production expectations, they produce good movies and this is not an exception.

Idk why this is so amazing wow 10/10 I Hope
There will me Mulan 2
Yes this movie doesn't have Mushu, but this movie really amazing, me and my family really enjoy watching it

Loyalty, Brave, True, Devotion to FamilyIt was a live action that I was very much looking forward to. I thought it was going to be more detailed than the animated version but I feel there are lots of things left unexplained/not developed enough.The qualities required to be a good girl in that period of time are not explained well.
The Matchmaker gets angry due to an accident of Hua Xiu (Mulan's sister) trying to avoid a spider. Instead of making it a mistake of Mulan's 'manliness' or recklessness, this invalidates the anger of the Matchmaker towards Mulan. Also, in the animated version she needs to recite poetry during the meeting with the matchmaker and it emphasises that she is not like the rest and that she has no intention to/cannot become the rest. Therefore the contrast is not shown as thoroughly.
She does not cut her hair like Mulan does in the original animated version. This makes it less emotional because we feel less of the pain and the sacrifice that Mulan has to endure to risk her life for her family.The friendship between Commander Tung and Hua Zhou feels shallow as well. And what is the point of the bird? If you are going to leave Mushu out leave all the magic out please.To conclude, characters are not developed enough to be as gripping as it could be with the storyline.

Actually i would rate this lower but with all haters givning it a1 simply becaue they just expected a re-watch of the cheesier animated movie, is nuts.What I liked about the movie:Some magic to explain Mulans impossible abilites, instead of the animated Disney, making these powers unexplained completely.God fighting sceens, much better than the cheesy Hollywood scenes common today with western actresses mostly trying to look cool by static poses , and having super human strengths without any magic or explaination at all.Good acting overall, photo and environments, scenery is wonderful and villains that are not simply pure evil is also refreshing compared to Hollywoods formula.If you think the Disneys animated Mulan is a great emotional movie you love, and expert this to be a remake/re-run , you better just re-watch the Animated Mulan. If you are looking for more of an action movie with better visuals and less rom-com, then this movie is good entertainment and highly underrated.
I love the animated Mulan, but this remake does not have all the loved characters. Disney failed again with this movie. So sad with movies like this.... this movie is not worth seeing...

Review title: I prefer this version over the cartoon
Review_body: I love all things Disney but the Mulan Cartoon is not my favorite. I was glad they did not "make a man" out of Mulan musical! The action and scenery was great! I hope we get more adventures of live action Mulan.

If you're expecting a redo of the 1998 film you'll be disappointed. But as a stand alone film and new iteration of the legend of Mulan it's well done! (And visually beautiful!!)
This movie wasn't soulless, it was stoic. I appreciated that the emotions weren't over the top, and think that the the classic Disney humor of the 1998 film would have been the wrong choice for this movie.
Gong Li's character had real depth and was a great foil for Mulan. She was original and refreshing!
Drawbacks: Chi aspect needed to be expanded upon more, and the musical callbacks were weak. The 1998 movie has great music that they failed to capitalize on.

I know it's very different than the original Disney animated version. If you can put that aside, it's actually really good. My parents who are very traditional and conservative Chinese parents loved it. It really highlights the virtues that are heavily emphasized in Chinese culture like filial piety to your parents, loyalty to your country, and being true. That was my favorite part!

Review title: No Mushu, I'm Into The Classic Cartoon.
Review_body:
Wish They Added Mushu Mulan's Classic Sidekick In The Remake. CGI Would've Worked.
I Understand Why This Movie Didn't Add Mushu But Classic Characters Are Gonna Have The Best Lines Throughout The Film No Doubt.

There is nothing wrong with the actors work, it's just that the characters lack depth and the only one that is evolving trough the film is the bad guy (woman). None of the soldiers evolve and you don't really get to know them. There are several gaps in the story that only would be filled with the parts from the original story that has been cut away. The ending leaves you on hold, wondering what really happened, and IF something even happened during these app. 2 hours. The things that gave the original movie joy - the songs, the humour and the romance - has been erased and what is left is just a bland movie with cool fighting moves.

I never write reviews, this is my first. I created an account just to add this review (simply because so many people gave it a negative review, and the movie deserved a good one!) I've been holding off watching this movie...due to the bad reviews and everything I've read in the media about it. But I can't believe I let the negative reviews keep me from watching it. It's not a musical, like the original, but original songs are included in an instrumental manner. Many people are upset that it isn't like the original, but Disney put a great spin on it. Of course it's not going to be the same! The storyline is very close to the original though. The cinematography and colors are awesome! The fight scenes are very entertaining and it was a great watch!

Not sure why people think a remake is supposed to be the same. What were people expecting a musical. The witch part I can understand why people wasn't happy with that but the cartoon has a little dragon and a cricket.

Review title: Dishonor on us, Dishonor on disney
Review_body:
This was the single worst piece of crap I have ever wasted my life on.
If I had to guess I would never believe it came out of the creator of my favorite movies.
The movie was written by someone who never read a book or saw a movie in it's life. a better title for the movie would be "We let a bot watch 10K hours of mulan and this is what it wrote"
the dialogues were empty, the story was so elaborated you had to understand nothing on your own.
the only message this movie conveys is "men are helpless without women, women have superpowers, men are bad"
the main character is a flat character- she finishes exactly where she started with no character growth whatsoever.
the movie made me fell nothing but total disgust.
I advice disney to rewatch the good mulan and write down what made it good (hint, it has a story, character development, depth, deep symbolism and...well...we all think it so I might as well say it...FUN!)
the only 2 good things about this movie are the panorama and the Disney logo at the beginning.
this movie made a mockery of disney, of the story of mulan, of the fans of disney, and of the viewer's intelligence.
I was appalled for days.
tu sum it up, in words of the one and only Eddie Murphy: Dishonor on you, dishonor on your house, dishonor on your cow!

This is not a remake, far from it. This is hardly even a retelling. Almost everything that made the original story great has been replaced by poor story telling and terrible dialogue. There's a lack of exposition at times that makes the directing seem lazy and the writing inept. Something about a Phoenix? A magic/chi system that has no explanation and no bearing on the story? Vague bad guy motivation? Yep, Mulan has it all! I get that Disney didn't want to make a carbon copy of the original, but this is a massive misfire. There is a lack of weight to all the emotional and important moments that could've been fixed if this film had someone read the script before okaying it. 3 stars because it looked good and I liked some of the actors.

Having read some of the reviews, I was not so keen to watch the film but my 10 year old daughter twisted my arm. I'm glad she did. My daughter loved the film and I enjoyed it too.It's a great family film with a simple story, visually stunning and a good pace. My daughter loved the action scenes and the fact that it depicted a women whose talents and energy meant she could outcompete the men.What I thought it lacked was some emotional depth between the key characters which could have made it a more exceptional film. But if you are looking for an uncomplicated movie that has stunning cinematography and can give your children an opportunity to have a little taste of Chinese culture, then I would recommend what my daughter said to me - take a look and make up your own mind :)
Really enjoyed this. Lots of references to other films. Focus was on the character of Mulan.

Review title: I think this movie offers a valuable lesson here
Review_body: When you go back to work on Monday, stay later and work harder than everyone else. If you keep doing that, you will get noticed and one day you will rise to the top like Mulan did. And if you save your money and invest wisely, one day you will have a lot of money, and then you will finally be able be able to afford the therapy you need to begin piecing your life back together after watching this movie.

Review title: Very Chinese, therefore appropriate and beautiful
Review_body: If you are an American who has any enjoyment in Chinese films, then you will like this. It's definitely Disney'ed, but without knowing the Legend outside of this context, I think they did a great job honoring this legend. The acting is great. So happy to see Donny Yen and surprised to discover Jet Li plays the emporer. I was also touched they gave Ming-Na Wen a cameo!!! I greatly enjoyed the changes made to the film from the 1998 version. The changes made were perfect, sensible, realistic and definitely made much more sense of certain scenes in the 1st film. The ONLY thing I would change would be to have it filmed in the native tongue (Mandarin) with sub-titles. Well done!

When they said that we were getting a mulan reboot, I personally expected a live action version of the movie we know and love. The goofy nature of Mushu, the excellently written soundtrack, the dynamic natures of each character's personality.. yet, expectations were dropped to an all time low upon viewing this trainwreck.Disney, when you said we were getting a reboot, we didn't want the (not even) historically accurate version, because that's not a reboot. It's just the original story put into a clunky mess of script. What we wanted was something familiar. The timeless masterpiece you created back in the days of 2D Disney. But instead, we receive something that barely quenches our thirst for adventure and comedy. All I have to say is, thanks for everything, but this was the wrong order.
Nobody cares about China's cultural view or censorship bullcrap quit ruining good movies to appeal to other countries viewing pleasure no Mushu what kind of trash is this

Review title: I enjoyed the music and how it followed the actual book
Review_body: I have read the original Mulan book and it actually was beautiful how it went along with the books original work and not an edited version of the book to make it G rated for little children. Don't get me wrong I love the animated version however this is more accurate to the legend of Mulan. Also loved the credits music how they decided to have some of the original songs sung at the end and also have Reflections sung in Mulan's actual native tongue.
There was not a minute that I could say it was worth the time. No other comments are possible. Simply a waste of time.

Review title: i don't get the negative comments, this movie is surely 8/10
Review_body:
All these bad reviews have no explication.
I didn't watch the animation made in 1998 so my review is regards, about the movie itself.
The movie is very good, a bit boring in the beginning afterwards t's amazing.
Talks probably too much about girls value trough the battle, who are not accepted in combat, but only to become housewives.
Actually I am a conservative man but still like girls with a strong attitude like this one, also she is very good fighting.
I feel probably many men are triggered about that.
IMBD reviews lately are meaningless, seems people just get a review
when they are upset or angry.
Calm down guys, if you did Karate when you were a child like I used to, there were also girls doing it, girls can do Karate or Kung-Fu. Chill.
The movie is good watch it.

I absolutely enjoyed this movie and watched at home (with and without the kids) a few times now. Please don't compare it to the cartoon - it's not a remake of the cartoon. It's a great movie, great actors, I thought it was very well done.

Review title: Worst movie in History of Disney
Review_body:
They changed the whole story.
It should've been original instead of Jet-lee super powered movie.
Well, this is what you get when you let Chinese directs movie.I stopped the movie at 1/5 or 1/6 and I couldn't continue watching which would be a waste of my time.

Disney remakes reap yet another soul. They took everything charming about the movie. The incorporation of Qi is honestly a good concept, but they got it all wrong. Mushu is gone and now there's some Phoenix instead??? This movie also doesn't understand show don't tell. It's not worth the time so don't even bother watching this.

I thought it will be so bad film looking at the rating.. but it isnt that bad... i still can enjoy the film for the cartoon hardcore fans just keep to watch cartoon maybe life action movie just not for you xD maybe ur just a cartoon lover thats why the movie gonna just upsetting you hahaha this is the movie not cartoon why people expect it to be 100% same lol this

A dreadful and disappointing film, a horrible adaptation of the animated movie. The animated onde iis the best movie I have seen in my life! Real touching scenes, real beautiful music, real morality, real debates on legality between men and women. This adaptation ignored the beautiful disney music, the wonderful mulan transformation scene created by disney! an abomination, luckily I have not seen this film in the theaters! The actors play terribly, the scenes make no sense. They really screwed up my childhood and my favorite movie, ! I recommend the animated!
I really enjoyed this. After reading all the poor ratings I am really glad I hadn't ever watched the original animated movie. I just watched it for what it was and I really enjoyed it.

I liked this movie. I understand some people who have already watched its animation may not find it interesting but that does not mean this movie is garbage as some pople have reviewed it as. I find everything about the movie perfect. Throughout the movie, in many places, you will find scenes that can move you to tears. I loved the acting of the girl who played Mulan.
It's a way too simple and naive. I know and I love disney's movies, but there was no magic.

In my own opinion, what happened on this movie is amazing it becomes more realistic than the animated one. It might not that funny but it shows what how great the life on China before...this is what I really called Ravishing.
Truly one of the best movies this year so far.Have not seen any other Mulan related movies/series so for me this is "just a movie" if you know what i mean...

This movie makes me so angry. It is absolutely awful. Mulan goes through no character growth at all, which was supposed to be the entire point of the story. She's painted as this perfect character who can do no wrong and nothing inherently changes her. That's terrible story writing. There's also the ethics of filming this movie behind the scenes which makes it horrible and it's not even worth it because the movie sucks. The editing is also bad and the changes to the story add nothing and only makes it worse.
Like Aladdin, Jungle Book, etc the live action is different enough without losing the story. Fight choreography is spectacular.
How disappointing. I watched until these guys ran up walls? Its a shame Disney made such a mockery of the classic Mulan.
Want more series of this story. Waiting for it. Hoping to ccontinue the story.

The movie was boring to say the least. I'm Chinese, so watching this was painful and sad.What kind of person removes Shang, Mushu and the music for more "realistic" feel, ONLY TO ADD A FLYING BIRD WITCH WHO ISNT EVEN PART OF CHINESE MYTHOLOGY. Witches didn't exist in China. And if they did, (like a Taoist or alchemist) they would be highly respected.

Don't really care that it has differences to 1998 mulan, I actually hoped they would change it up a bit. But this movie is so bad, the visual effects are terrible, story is all over the place at times and writing is horrible.Mulan has the potential to be a masterpiece and this is the complete opposite of that.

Review title: Park your expectations of an updated animation and see the beauty.
Review_body: Outstanding film. Completely different to the amazing animation. If the park your expectations of watching the original and watch the film with fresh eyes you will see it beauty, excitement, amazing cinematography, costumes and acting.

There was a time that Disney knew what they are doing and now we live in a period of time that they are literally what has been achieved hardly.Have to wash the cartoon again to wash this poison away.Actually, I recommend to watch the pirated version, So it would an example how to not make a movie.
They used the name from the original and that was about it. Some great landscape scenes but overall it was bad and cringeworthy.

If you're looking for a exact remake of the original movie then go see it again, this one is different and surprised me for it! It's an almost 2 hour movie that seems like 30 minutes! The acting is good, the dialogues are straight forward and there aren't any slow moments! Visual is fantastic and the fight scenes are very simple and not really explored! Just loved it!

Mulan (2020) is a very good movie! It does a great job honoring the Chinese culture and history while correcting some of the inaccuracies of the 'original' (the Huns were mainly in Europe). If you allow it to stand on it's own merits, you'll enjoy it; if you watch it while constantly comparing it to the animated version, you'll likely be disappointed.

Review title: One of the better live action remakes
Review_body:
I know feelings are mixed because you didn't get your talking dragon, singing, and funny grandma. HOWEVER, this is one of the most well done of the live action remakes. It's visually, stunning. The composers outdid themselves, you still get the melodic structure of "Reflection" and other songs from the animated film at key moments and the execution is done so well. The film is also action packed and entertaining. Don't expect the laughs you get in the animated film, go
Into the film knowing it's a different movie and different telling of the legend of Hua Mulan. I love that it is not a line-for-line remake of the animated version, if I wanted that I would just watch the animated version.

Ok, I admit I never saw the animated version but did after I saw this brilliant live-action adaptation that is clearly a different version. I found the animated version very sophomoric, like you would expect in a film for kids. Eddie Murphy as a Dragon genie, funny, but nothing Chinese about it and rather insulting to the ancient Chinese culture. I think Disney made the smart, respectful choice by making the live-action version truer to the sense of ancient Chinese mythology while still preserving all the Disney family values. Most importantly, value for women. We rarely get to see women playing heroic roles, so as a father of a 16 month old girl, I can't wait to show her this incredible film when she's older and can understand it. What I can't understand right now is how anyone could hate this movie at all, perhaps they just don't get good cinema or culture in general?

This movie was an epic masterpiece with its successful attempt to provide us another point of view of Milan's legend, while still making some references of Disney's animated movie.The actors are outstanding and all the music and graphics are beyond measure.I can not comprehend how this movie got so underrated by the public, I guess the only explanation is that people wished to see the same movie but remade as live action as happened with Lion King, which I am really glad that did not happen or it would have been a waste of time and energy.Now we got the perfect opportunity to have both sides of the coin, one of Milan's light, fun and musical version and another with all her power and exuberance.It is thrilling to watch this movie and ask yourself how have you been true to your own voice.
Despite what others say. I thought it wasa great movie with a new take on the story. I liked that they tried to make it closer to the source matetial.

Review title: Wow, these reviews are unnecessarily harsh
Review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. I thought that they did a great job with a beloved Disney flic. It was visually stunning and heartwarming to boot. Lighten up people, it was a positive addition to 2020!

Review title: I was glad to pay the $30 to support this movie
Review_body: Nothing ever beats the originals, but they did a good job and the actors were great. Another great family movie by Disney. Yifei Liu is a star!

Review title: Different but that's not 100% a bad thing
Review_body: I've read quite a few reviews... I'm surprised... while it is nothing like the original animated classic, it's not bad. It's not a carbon copy (cut for cut crap like the lion king). Mulan was one of my favorite movies growing up, yes the music was fab and it was hilarious... but really I think generally it was b/c she was so brave and a badass.. and here we are, that's the same. I love seeing them focus on the beauty of Chinese culture, landscape. I enjoyed it and will be watch it again!

Review title: Finally a live action that takes a risk and succeeds
Review_body: The live actions before this have been nothing than regurgitated less good versions of the animated.Disney learned and finally got Live Action right. This isn't the animated and that's good, it's a different story, it's a different Mulan that stands apart and has its own messages and it's own identity.This isn't a remake, it's a different universe of Mulan and should be viewed that way and not compared to the animated both are great in their own way. We don't compare the Marvel animated universe to the live action and the same goes here. Watch them both and enjoy them both.

Review title: Beautiful reimagining of the Mulan fable!
Review_body: This movie is NOT a remake of Disney's animated movie (in IMHO, one of Disney's best) . It IS a beautiful reimagining of the Mulan fable with loving nods to the original while standing completely on its own. This Mulan is artistically constructed, shot and acted. The costumes are fantastic, the photography is gorgeous, the action is exciting and the acting is superb. Allow that this is a fairy tale, not a Chinese history lesson, like some critics seem to think (although the care and research on the period is phenomenal), and you can appreciate what a very special piece of art this beautiful movie is. There is room in the universe for both of Disney's takes on this story.
I loved this retelling of Mulan. I loved the acting, the story, the cinematography and I loved how much heart and soul there is.

Review title: There Is a Lot to Love About This Movie
Review_body: Having read some of the reviews before seeing this movie, I was surprised how much I actually enjoyed it, especially given it was a well known story so losing the suspense element of the story. A film well made, from acting to writing to cinematography to action sequence to special effect. Really don't understand the haters.

Review title: I'd rather prefer the Disney original one
Review_body: It was quite boring with some unexacting stuff but not exactly as the original story. I would not highly recommend it if you are not a Disney fan. I'd rather prefer the cartoons one, I saw it many times during my childhood and it's definitely which I'm going to keep.

As a native Chinese, the biggest issue I have is the bad writing. Many dialogs are poorly written culture-wise from both Western/American point of view or Asian/Chinese point of view. I can get past the predictable plot since it's a live-action remake, but the story is very inadequately executed and several plot-points are absurd and ridiculous. Many times I found myself asking -- "Huh? Why would they do that!" Moreover, even though it's marketed as an "Action" movie, the movie is also lacking any impressive action sequences which could have made it more entertaining. Battle scenes feel small, and many open-field sets feel confined and cramped. I was expecting LOTR or Avenger level battles but instead, I got a couple of dozen people doing some badly designed and executed martial arts in an enclosed movie set. Don't get me wrong, you have a group of very well trained martial arts actors (Donnie Yen, Jet Li, Jason Scott Lee), but feels like someone from a kungfu store in a strip-mall came up with the fighting sequences. Hell, The Matrix has better fighting scenes than this. Overall, the star-packed Mulan is an Action-Drama lack of both. What a shame!

Been waiting for this movie for a while. Thought it's gonna be a great colossal wu xia epic from the trailer. But no.Beside the actress, I think a lot of thing is wrong here. And with that big budget can't they afford a proper wuxia and Chinese culture consultant? The Chinese culture is butchered a lot here. Although the cast are Asian, it doesn't feel like Chinese. Good luck if they want to sell this in China.The director and producers should at least refers to some of the early Tsui Hark's wu xia filmography and enrich a bit about the wu xia culture through some Cin Yung's novel. Even the anime got it right better than this one.Mulan character and strength development progress doesn't feel continuous. And the sudden twist in the middle and the ending is confusing. Dialogues are very weak.It's very surprising. Disney has some excellent story telling capability and some of the best stories in animated why they real life always fall short? This one is the most disappointing of all.There's no honor in this movie.#Mulan2020

This movie is so much better than rated here. It is fantasy, epic and colorful with a strong message. It is well shooted and a stunning dynamic camera with great landscape settings. A perfect family movie!

What a beautiful reimagining of this story. The bad reviews clearly just wanted a word for word remake of the cartoon classic. This is not that, it's better. It's about being proud to be a woman and proud of our incredible POWER! Thank you Disney for showing that women are STRONG, POWERFUL, MAGICAL creatures! 🙌🙌🙌

Review title: It was fantastic, grand in scale and a cinematic gem.
Review_body: The first 10 minutes of the movie was a bit disjointed but after that, it was solid from front to back. I liked the character development and secondary stories. I loved the larger than life battle scenes and epic panoramic sequences. I did not see the original cartoon and judging by some people's reaction, glad as such. This was a standalone movie made with grown up themes.

This was supposed to be a classic and they just destroyed the story... You can't make a little dragon, but you can make a wich and dudes running on walls? What about using a Phoenix!? It's a mith from Greek mythology isn't it!? The Fenghuang is from the Chinese mythology. And although sad, the women were not given any opportunities. That was perfectly described in the animation... Why change it so much!? Just sad...
This was a lovely, poetic and engaging remake. Fantastic acting, directing and cinematography. I loved the animation Mulan and this did not disappoint.

Review title: Story of Mulan not adaptation of animation...
Review_body: I can appreciate the extent of research and investment Disney has gone for this movie. Including nthe amount of work that went into choosing the lead role. This is definitely a REMAKE, not a shot for shot adaptation of the animation. I originally was upset like everyone else about the removal of Mushu but as I researched why. I discovered, what I loved about Disney, their attention to detail. They were able to remake a movie and hold true to cultural details that the western culture may not understand. So yes, if you are looking for the motion picture shot for shot adaptation of the animation you'll be disappointed. If you're looking for an inspiring representation of the Mulan story for your family 10/10 all day.

Review title: Do you expect another white-washing? Forget it...
Review_body: Be gentle...Do you expect another white-washing? Not this one...Go and watch Mulan 90s...Reviewers giving bad rating are the one who are soulless..just so you know my daughters love this movie and the original too...so what's your problem...get a life....stuck in your head...it's creative entertainment...

So I almost Remember al the Disney movies from my childhood But the old mulan mmm I didn't realy remember
I watched this one with my 2 daughters 5&9
We liked it
A really nice movie
For them and me

Review title: Do not compare to the original Disney movie! It's different; but still worth the watch!
Review_body: It's a lot more serious than the Mulan we watched growing up but still really enjoyed the movie.There are some characters that felt like unnecessary additions and made no significant impact on the story line but the main casts were great.

I was looking forward to watching this remake when I heard that unlike some of the previous remake attempts this would not be a shot for shot remake, but instead a more realistic style film with no songs. I love the original and liked the idea of a new take on the story that brought something different.However what I got was a lifeless film that hadn't really gone for realism and felt more like a clunky superhero story. The editing was so poor I felt like I was watching a student film, there was no character that really felt memorable and the entire message of the original film had been lost by giving Mulan superpowers from birth instead of us watching her learn and push herself.A lot of the big emotional moments from the original fall flat, and there's just no fun or heart left. I'd really like to see Disney focus on coming up with more quality new stories instead of remaking every old film but worse.

Review title: I loved it because I knew what to expect.
Review_body: Mulan has always been my favorite Disney movie. Because of that I followed the making of it and didn't expect the happy-go-lucky movie the original is. I love that it is more true to the culture it comes from and is reminiscent of classic Chinese martial arts movies.

There was absolutely no need for this piece of work, when the original movie was such a masterpiece. This movie is about a bunch of soulless and robotic characters which make questionable decisions throughout. Disney, please stop doing this, and think of better ways for making money.

I almost never leave reviews, but man, this was bad.Since Mulan is probably my favourite Disney movie and my favourite princess, I was super excited for this movie, and needless to say, had high expectations.This movie tried so hard to NOT be like the cartoon that The story got stripped of all its soul, fun, and logic. Somehow everything managed to become overly dramatic, while acting was non-existing. There was no Development to the characters. There's no music, which is funny considering that most Disney movies are musicals. They replaced the dragon with a Phoenix (why?!).This movie left me so icky and unsatisfied that I just went and watched the original Mulan immediately after.The only positive thing about this movie is the cinematography, and the fight scenes. For the rest, this movie is not worth your money. Do yourself a favour and skip it.

Don't trust the bad reviews and watch this. It's actually a pretty good adaptation of the historic story of Mulan. I was skeptical about watching, especially Moshu was not part of the movie, but there was no room for Moshu here. It's a great movie just as it is, without the westernized addition. It shows a great power and respect to women too, so well done!

Review title: Dose not deserve all the negatives
Review_body: Great movie.... keep an open mind..... Keep in mind you are not watching the animated movie from 1998 which was made with children in mind. The movie has a great storyline and can easily inspire young minds. "You can be/do what ever you want to just as long as you do everything you can to get to your goals"
Void of any strong emotion. Exploitative of a feminist storyline that ultimately even fails at being feminist. Completely forgettable.Also, the fake bots giving it 9 or 10 are rampant.

Review title: A beautiful adoption of the a beloved classic
Review_body: Beautiful movie worthy of the silver screen. Although it's missing the musical aspect of the original there are still small hints of the original music in the film

Review title: Worth watching if you don't expect it to be the same as an animated film
Review_body: The film should not be compared to animation version. Movie is totally different and focus is on Mulan's bravery and devotion to her family and her emperor. Whole story follows her path where she reveals the 4 most important virtues of life. She discovers that she must accept these virtues in order to be true warrior.

I am not going to compare this movie with the original Mulan (1998), because it's not a true story and anyone can change the sequence of events.
I found it very fascinating that someone had the gut to change some parts of the story, and to develop it in some more realistic ways.
A lot of essential characters where excluded but the core of the story is still the same.
I was taken by the production and the way this movie was directed. Very colourful, very catchy, and very fast.
Liu Yifei gave the character its right but I guess it would have been better if they kept Mulan's character as it was meant to, fun and enthusiastic.
It's very difficult for anyone to accept any kind of change in a story, especially if they were very attached to it, but my advice to you is to give it try!
A very linear storyline with a lack of excitement, a very bland experience overall. The acting was also very poor.

To be totally honest from another director and cinematographer, I can see good and bad with this movie. Nobody can say its all bad but how ever, it is far from the best I have seen. I can see this movie had a great budget and the actors weren't great but ok and we must not forget that this is a kids movie. I saw many places that I would do this differently but that's always easier to say second hand. There is many parts of this movie were I find they should have done it differently in both filming and directing but I am not the targeted audience as im over 30, I would not recommend this to people over the age of 7 but other than that I can except this movie. I can type down all the good and the bad but I feel as a casual movie goer that this should suffice.
Beautiful scenery, but that's all that this movie has got going for it, shocking dialogue, wooden acting, clichés everywhere, avoid this movie and watch the original animation

I must admit I don't remember watching the original animated version (so I won't/ can't compare it to the decades old animated version like most of the reviews I've seen. This movie was very entertaining and I enjoyed the action (with all the legendary action stars in it) I expected as much. The cast was awesome, I will watch it again and recommend to friends. Just how I thought the live action version of the story would be.

A horrible adaptation of a Disney classic. All themes are lost and Chinese culture is replaced with European lore and values. Glaring plot holes and terrible character development are abundant within this garbage film. Save some time and watch something else..... Oh and the cinematography was beautiful.No mushu.....

Review title: If I could give this movie 0 stars, I would
Review_body: If you're interested in watching Mulan, go for the animation version, not this movie.

Review title: Will RUIN how you think of Mulan forever
Review_body: This movie is not even good as a stand alone film. But as a remake, and comparing it to the original makes it that much worse. The original Mulan is one of my favorite movies and I waited so long for this movie to come out and was incredibly excited. What a disappointment! They took out everything good from the original, all the amazing songs, witty humor, MUSHU, and even the plot and storyline. I'm fine with remakes not following the exact path of its predecessor, especially if they improve it, but this was a pretty much completely different story that is loosely based on the original. They breeze through parts that, in the original film, were main points for character development and building up momentum. Plus they introduce so much magic that it makes everything logical in the movie so useless.Is weird to say that the cartoon had better cinematography than the live action version? Not to mention better acting. That chilling part when the Huns charge and the soldiers come down the mountain by the thousands used to make my heart skip a beat. The war scenes in this film are just boring and overly choreographed. Mulan's flips and magical moves are really too much and it makes the war scenes kind of pointless. She was much more believable in the cartoon for the fact that, yes while she was a skilled fighter, she also used her brain and devised clever plans and tricks many times to overtake the enemy. She didn't just magically do flips and kick an arrow into the enemy's heart.With all that said - this movie is TERRIBLE and I do not recommend if you don't want to ruin your image of one of the best Disney movies

It was a very nice and good movie!!! Finally their is a movie with a female warrior... And everybody hear writes the most negative reviews... I no many really bad male warrior movies with got a food review here.Me and my family like the movie and story...

Review title: The Real Disney died with Walt and Roy, who didn't have to answer to shareholders!
Review_body: This is the Disney Corporate machine trying to appease shareholders with the marketing approach common to luxury items such as diamonds. By setting ridiculous prices for a variety of luxury products the sellers seek to establish a high value for an item with no basis in fact. The outrageousness of the price to view Mulan becomes the story, overshadowing any of the movie's actual merits. Don't misunderstand, Mulan is worth a look. Will you come away thinking, "Oscar contender", or "Movie of the Year"? Doubtful. But while it does have its charms, it is mired in mediocrity with a predictable storyline, stereotypical characters, and borrowed martial arts and swordfight choreography from the likes of "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" who did it first and did it better. Under the period costumes and lavish sets, it is your typical "underdog beats impossible odds" movie. But credit where credit is due. No where did I see a caucasian, or non-Asian casting, so we have at least progressed from the days of Charlie Chan movies? I do tire of the commonality of the recent spate of movies with women characters tieing down their bosoms to pose as men. It takes a real "suspension-of-disbelief" for an audience to accept their disguise would fool anyone. But hey, if Superman can be Clark Kent by the mere addition of glasses, and no one is the wiser, then anything is possible in the land of movies and comic books.

Review title: Did you all expect another princessy movie?
Review_body:
All Disney movies have some "moral" behind every script. This one was "loyal to family, brave and true". It was on the point. Believe it or not it was like this back then in imperial China times. So much bad reviews from those viewers who cannot span their horizon and grasp the concept.
If you expected singing and dancing like Alladin then don't watch this movie. If you want to see a pretty good story line - and kickass Asian actors then go see this.
Really, really terrible. Either make the same movie again or make an entirely new one, but this movie took the strong elements of the original and made them weak.

Mulan is a visual feast, and nothing more. It's a bland, lifeless mess of a film with watered down stakes, poor characters, no humour, and no heart. If anything, it's shown just how masterful the 1998 animation is.Mulan was just an ordinary girl, who went on to do extraordinary things, burdened by societal constrictions and driven by love, loyalty, and honour. But this version of Mulan is wooden and hollow. There is no weight to her decisions, no urgency, because she's the chosen one. And although Disney has proclaimed this to be an empowering film for women, applying the 'chosen one' archetype to the female lead (if you ask me) is a funny way of promoting female empowerment. If anything, it's disparaging, disheartening, and a huge step back compared to it's predecessor.

Review title: This movie was so damn bad.
Review_body: Literally this movie makes no sense and there's no music. I cannot express enough how bad this movie is.

Review title: Mulan - An Emotional Story Of Resolved Issues
Review_body: Mulan is an ancient Chinese story set in a magical colorful world where things get quirky as soon as the best characters come on the screen. All of the characters are memorable without feeling silly. The film is daring enough to make its demands clear. In a time of war there can only be commitment. There is no courage without fear. That is the theme on which the film presents its battles of will from. There is always a line you cannot or are not able to cross. The battle between the two protagonists always stays light which only better conveys subtly showing the perceived empathetic role of women in the society of that time.There is finally a movie that brings a lot of the most famous Chinese actors together in a passionate portrayal of battles that show no deceit. There is nothing sinister in the movie all but a simple victory for those on the right side of history.Even though the film might some to seem to some to be heavy on the main actress the film never forgets that there are others who matter too. A presentation of armies, its composition and their capabilities look believable and the strategies employed are never over the top.Anyways a great movie with great actors. A film with only positive messages all around but still enough meat to spark a conversation about interpersonal issues that any film about a society inevitably shows. Family friendly, hell yeah, and the fighting scenes are technically amazing and inspiring, Nobody should disengage anyone about seeing this movie.Thanks China. (Made In America) :)

I liked it from the beginning til the end. Some movie
remakes diverge from the original. Those who gave this movie a terrible rating live in the past by comparing it to the cartoon. Watch it!

While the casting was beyond perfect, the choice of a non-Asian director kept us away from watching an Epic version of Mulan!
Additionally the storytelling was poor and very..."dry"!
And last but not least, when you are Disney, for sure can handle a budget for having the dialogue original in both languages, English and Chinese (Cantonese/Mandarin)!
A missed opportunity for Disney to create an Asian Masterpiece!PS: Seriously, The Avengers had more badass action choreographies! And this movie had Donnie Yen and Jet Li!!!
Everything is incomplete with story. Pointless end.

I think sometimes people become so entranced with a movie that when it is redone that people cannot accept the changes. Some times this is warranted as in the 1997 version of Twelve Angry Men, but sometimes I think it is the inability to move forward. The movie was done well in much the same style as Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon with some fantastic and unrealistic moves, but it is still entertaining and with wonderful cinematography. I really enjoyed the movie.

There's really a lot to love here. C'mon folks, it's a fairy tale very well told, beautifully filmed and well acted. I expect the actors had a job to do to train for their action sequences. And the Crouching Tiger-Hidden Dragon style magic gave it an extra touch of mystery (so what if it's not reality?!) Like all fairytales and folktales it was meant to convey ideas - many of which we'd do well to hear more often - even in less beautiful and creative ways.

I liked the fact that its a different story from the animated, unlike other Disney movies that copied the original and gave it a National Geographic twist(Lion king).But i would like to see a better growth on the main character ... Mulan´s already a incredible "acrobat" from the beginning of the movie. I would have like to see her SLOWLY discover how amazing of a fighter she is.

The characters are simply drawn and the plot was never going to be more than a sketch, but there is humour, subtleties and references that that kept it interesting till the end.As simple as an adventure or as complex as a Father/Daughter tale of honour, the film is worth the money to watch it.

Review title: Best live action adaptation of Mulan in the world.
Review_body: I watched 1998 Disney, 2009 China and this 2020 Disney versions. Kids outside China will love the 1998 version which was comical and fun. The China version is serious and boring but delivered Mulan's character more realistically.However, i like this 2020 version the best from Disney. I love the background scenery, exciting fighting, mesmerizing use of colors, great acting from YiFei and fantastic surround sound effects. 2 hours seems to past much very fast. It should had been a 2.5 hrs film to explain more details fully. This film seems like a rush.

Review title: Completely misses the whole point of the story
Review_body:
This film is nothing like what was promised. It's not a more realistic version of the animated version and doesn't even hold to the values. The whole point of the ballad, and original film, is to show that while men and women have small differences they are both equal where it matters. The animated film manages this rather well as both Mulan and the male troop grow to become warriors together. In the new, 'more realistic', film Mulan is born with Chi, which is shown to be basically magic. This gives her an added advantage when it comes to fighting and so doesn't really promote the message that all women are equal to all men. It totally muddle the message. Then to add insult to injury they make her completely personality-less and give her no real drive of her own.
Mulan is meant to be an intelligent woman who uses her brain to overcome issues her physical abilities. This Mulan has none of that and makes stupid nonsensical decisions.
Overall just save your money and either watch the animated Disney version or one of the many Chinese films based on the ballad. This film is a shameless, directionless cash grab that doesn't have a clue what it wants to say. Worse yet, it's not even entertaining, you'll be frustrated with the character the whole way through.

Review title: Don't listen to the bad reviews. It is a great movie.
Review_body: First of all this movie is based on the real Mulan story. From beginning to end, it was entertaining. From cinematography to story, you will enjoy this very much. I know many people hate on it because it is not as their childhood movie Mulan, but grow the hell up. Also probably because of the main actress using her voice on the situation in hong kong. For this movie just push all politics out of the way and just enjoy this world in the movie and follow the story. You will not be disappointed.

Where's Mushu?Definitely, a different take of Mulan and a good movie. It's not animated and it doesn't follow the animated storyline to the T. Nonetheless, the movie does have a lot of different takes of the storyline. I didn't expect it to be like this but I still enjoyed the movie.With that said, this movie reminds me of Chinese movies with a Disney twist.

For example, they way Mulan lost her father's sword...the pheonix literally does nothing...the witch sacrificing herself to save Mulan...the avalanche scene...poor character development...its like there is no natural flow .The movie is average nothing more nothing less. On the good side, i liked the soundtracks and music compositions. Its enjoyable in its on way. The fight scenes are excuted pretty well but need more polish. Mulan is Mulan and not a super powered human, its good that she shows some weakness in fights. But generally..in the end...its just an average movie that could have been better.

Review title: Strong Female Lead + All Asian Cast + "Fans" With Specific Expectations = Great Film with Bad Reviews

Review title: It's not a remake, it's a re-imagining of an EPIC story
Review_body: I am frustrated with the reviews here that only talk about the fact that this movie was not a comedy or a musical like Mulan (1998). I love the first Mulan movie and in fact Mulan is one of my favorite Disney characters. I still sing songs from that movie to my children each night. But if I wanted to watch Mulan (1998), I would just watch the original.This movie is not meant to be a re-make, it is meant to be a re-imagining of a deeper story. A legend. A story about a woman who wants to be TRUE to herself but still respectful of her family, her culture, and her country. I think that the comedic relief of the Mushu character would have taken away from the important message that we can all stand to learn from this legend. Mulan learns that what she has within her is NOT something to be hidden away, but a gift that she can share with the world. I also thought the score of this movie was beautiful and the subtle references to the original brought tears to my eyes.If you want to watch Mulan (1998), then watch that movie and don't pay the $29.99 to watch this movie. But if you want to watch a movie with beautiful cinematography, music, and a story that any person across generations can learn something from, then I suggest you try this one.

If you are expecting a remake of the animated movie, you are going to be very disappointed, the movie does allude to certain part of the animated movie but it has it's own premise and it is pretty well executed.
The movie has traditional chinese film style with values being centered and fight scenes including cable work, Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan or Jet Li style.
The cinematography is superb and the scenery and costuming is amazing!
Give the movie an honest try and you might just find yourself loving it.

Much of what was cut out from the cartoon was never in the original story. So do not have expectations from the cartoon, but expectations of a different version of the story based off the actual Chinese legend.I enjoyed the movie, I'm sure you and your family will as well.
